thread.title: Paris Goes Car-Free Before a Major Climate Meeting

author: Svati Kirsten Narula
title: Paris Goes Car-Free Before a Major Climate Meeting
text:
So successful was Paris’s first “day without cars” on September 27 that the city’s mayor wants to expand the effort to help clean up the city’s terrible air quality. The single-day initiative made 30 percent of the city’s roads off-limits to automobiles, but even that minor reduction in traffic was enough to cut pollution levels—and noise—significantly.
More From Quartz This Is the Simplest Solution to Help Africans Live Longer Extreme Poverty Is Expected to Fall to an All-Time Low This Year Chinese Artist Ai Weiwei Says He Found “Listening Devices” in His Studio The Guardian reports that according to Airparif , which measures city pollution levels, some parts of Paris registered 40 percent less nitrogen dioxide (which produces smog) in the air on September 27. On the bustling Avenue des Champs-Élysées, nitrogen dioxide levels were 30 percent lower than on other Sundays. And Bruitparif, which measures urban noise, recorded half as much volume in the city center as normal.
Paris has struggled with embarrassingly smoggy air at times this year, and ahead of an international climate meeting in the French capital in November, mayor Anne Hidalgo is on a mission to clean things up.
Paris accompagne concrètement les Parisiens dans la lutte contre la pollution : http://t.co/D9MWJ2hR4g pic.twitter.com/GF3v2tMobJ

Le diesel est un carburant du passé. Il faut miser sur des véhicules écologiques, comme l'hybride et l'électrique. pic.twitter.com/T2f1Y2gGP9
— Anne Hidalgo (@Anne_Hidalgo) September 29, 2015 “My goal is to eradicate this harmful fuel in our city.”
La lutte contre le diesel est un sujet majeur pour Paris. Je le redis : mon objectif est d'éradiquer ce carburant nocif, dans notre ville.
— Anne Hidalgo (@Anne_Hidalgo) October 3, 2015 Hidalgo is also shooting to get cigarette butts off the street.
A #Paris , jeter un mégot dans la rue coûte désormais 68€ : http://t.co/M0uUyGrAOA (via @RTLFrance ) pic.twitter.com/csaj3EbT1v
— Anne Hidalgo (@Anne_Hidalgo) October 1, 2015 Her goal for the next car-free day is to encompass a larger section of the city.
La Journée sans Voiture sera reconduite en 2016 et nous la souhaitons dans l'ensemble de Paris #ConseildeParis pic.twitter.com/IiOhlG7Cp5
— Anne Hidalgo (@Anne_Hidalgo) September 29, 2015 And eventually, the hope would be for Paris to have monthly car-free days, Hidalgo has said.
Nous pourrions envisager des Journées sans voiture plus fréquentes. Une périodicité mensuelle pourrait ainsi être imaginée. #ConseildeParis
